**************************************************************
*** HOW TO INSTALL MINECRAFT FORGE WITH HD SUPPORT FOR START
**************************************************************
FIRST: Delete your existing .minecraft (back it up first using MCMyVault snapshot feature!) "C:\Users\<USERNAME>\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft"
(NOTE: You might be able to run this without deleting your world. I haven't tested it yet. Uninstalling ashikabi1modsetup.exe using its uninstaller should remove the mods it installed.)

1) Download and run Minecraft.exe, after title screen appears, press 'Quit Game' button. 
http://minecraft.net/download
2) Download ashikabi1modsetup.exe and run it. Leave everything checkmarked.
3) mcpatcher will start and Uncheckmark all mods shown in mcpatcher.
4) Mods->Add (or + button) and select the 
"1.5.1-mccustominstall\patches\minecraftforge-universal-1.5.xxxx.zip" to open
5) Make sure top level is selected and click OK.
6) Press the 'Patch" button.
7) Press "Test Minecraft" button and Forge should load for the first time.
8) Time to install the 'OptiFine HD standard' for better HD texture support; Mods->Add (or + button) 
and select the "\patches\OptiFine_1.x.x_HD_B1.zip" to open
9) Make sure top level is selected and click OK.
10) Mods->Add (or + button) and select the 
"[1.5.1]ReiMinimap.xxxx.zip" to open
11) Make sure top level is selected and click OK.
12) Press the 'Patch" button.
13) A Conflict will be detected but press Yes to "Only the files from OptiFine_1.5.1_HD_B1 will be used."
14) Press "Test Minecraft" button and Forge should load and OptiFine showing installed.

FINISHED. GO PLAY!

**************************************************************
*** TEXTUREPACKS
**************************************************************
Use https://mcmyvault.googlecode.com to restore texturepacks 
from your backup texturepack location
